item.title: Heather add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "If you have ever lost a loved one, then you know exactly how it feels. And if you have not, then you cannot possibly imagine it." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Heather add a quote by Jodi Picoult
item.description: "In the English language there are orphans and widows, but there is no word for the parents who loses a child." -- Jodi Picoult

item.title: Heather add a quote by Carrie Jones
item.description: "Losing people you love affects you. It is buried inside of you and becomes this big, deep hole of ache. It doesn't magically go away, even when you stop officially mourning." -- Carrie Jones

item.title: Heather add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "We were promised sufferings. They were part of the program. We were even told, 'Blessed are they that mourn,' and I accept it. I've got nothing that I hadn't bargained for. Of curse it is different when the thing happens to oneself, not to others, and in reality, not imagination." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Heather add a quote by William Cullen Bryant
item.description: "And we wept that one so lovely should have a life so brief;" -- William Cullen Bryant

item.title: Heather add a quote by Nina Guilbeau
item.description: "When you lose someone, you get used to living day to day without them. But you’ll never get used to the “10 second heartbreak.” That’s the time it takes to wake to full consciousness each day and remember…" -- Nina Guilbeau

item.title: Heather add a quote by Victoria Hanley
item.description: "I have lived with you and loved you, and now you are gone. Gone where I cannot follow, until I have finished all of my days." -- Victoria Hanley
